meanings.definition: Having or showing courage or determination.
meanings.sent1: The pluckier kitten bravely chased after the butterfly.
meanings.sent2: She felt pluckier than ever before as she stood up to the bully.
meanings.sent3: The pluckier squirrel fearlessly stole nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The pluckier firefighter rushed into the burning building to save the trapped cat.
meanings.sent5: The pluckier explorer ventured into the unknown jungle without hesitation.

meanings.definition: To pull or pick at with the fingers.
meanings.sent1: She pluckier the petals off the daisy one by one.
meanings.sent2: He pluckier the grapes from the vine to make wine.
meanings.sent3: The chef pluckier the herbs from the garden for the soup.
meanings.sent4: The child pluckier the feathers from the toy bird for a craft project.
meanings.sent5: The gardener pluckier the weeds from the flower bed to keep it tidy.

meanings.definition: To play (a stringed instrument) by plucking the strings with the fingers.
meanings.sent1: She pluckier the guitar strings to create a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent2: He pluckier the harp strings gently to produce soothing music.
meanings.sent3: The musician pluckier the banjo strings with skill and precision.
meanings.sent4: The street performer pluckier the ukulele strings for the crowd's enjoyment.
meanings.sent5: The student pluckier the violin strings to practice for the upcoming recital.
